physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient presented typical stigmata of hypothyroidism: macroglossia, a depressed nasal bridge, a wide open anterior fontanel, and a puffy face. The skin was cold and dry, with a small umbilical hernia. Muscular hypotonia was noted, and psychomotor development was at the level of a 6-week-old girl. The thyroid gland was of normal size per ultrasound. Retarded ossification of the knee was observed on X-Ray.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Free T4: 1.4 pmol/liter (normal, 10–22); Free T3: 1.27 pmol/liter (normal, 3.1–6.4); TSH: 0.19 mU/liter (normal, 0.3–5 mU/liter)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initiation of treatment with L-T4 resulted in improved serum free T4 and T3 concentrations, with values rising to 11.5 pmol/liter and 6.6 pmol/liter, respectively. The serum TSH level remained low at 0.07 mU/liter.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, the patient exhibited low levels of free T4, free T3, and TSH. After treatment, free T4 and T3 values improved, but psychomotor development remained retarded for age.
